definition: to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Until you have the expertise, don't bet on an inside straight.
sentences.chinese: 在你拥有这项专长前，不要在扑克中的顺子上下赌注。

sentences.english: A rarer gin hand is two sequences of five cards each.
sentences.chinese: 比较少见的“金”是手中有两副顺子，每副五张牌。

sentences.english: When she doesn't understand, but ugg boots appealing son bore so many.
sentences.chinese: 在她不知道的时候，顺子却承受了这么多。

sentences.english: Same goes with open ended straight and flush draws.
sentences.chinese: 有两端顺子和同花抽牌。

sentences.english: Follow the kind of son in rich brocade's eyes Be getting larger.
sentences.chinese: 在锦绣看来，顺子的变化就更大了。

definition: to bid (bridge and similar card games)
organizer of a gambling party who takes a cut of the winnings/banker (gambling)/preceding player (in a game)/(dialect) boss/proprietor
double happiness/the combined symmetric character 囍 (similar to 喜喜) as symbol of good luck, esp. marriage
to draw a tile (at mahjong)/to play mahjong
Wang Wu, name for an unspecified person, third of a series of three: 張三|张三[Zhang1 San1], 李四[Li3 Si4], 王五 Tom, Dick and Harry
Li Si, name for an unspecified person, second of a series of three: 張三|张三[Zhang1 San1], 李四, 王五[Wang2 Wu3] Tom, Dick and Harry
